'''Surface builders''' control how the surface of the terrain is shaped and what blocks it is generated with. Configured surface builders are stored as [[JSON]] files within a [[data pack]] in the path {{cd|data/<namespace>/worldgen/configured_surface_builder}}. They are used in [[world generation]].

== JSON format ==
<div class="treeview">
{{Nbt|compound}} The root tag
**{{Nbt|string|type}}:{{Needs testing}} The type of surface builder to use, must be one of <code>"default"</code>, <code>"mountain"</code>, <code>"shattered_savanna"</code>, <code>"gravelly_mountain"</code>, <code>"giant_tree_taiga"</code>, <code>"swamp"</code>, <code>"badlands"</code>, <code>"wooded_badlands"</code>, <code>"eroded_badlands"</code>, <code>"frozen_ocean"</code>, <code>"nether"</code>, <code>"nether_forest"</code>, <code>"soul_sand_valley"</code>, <code>"basalt_deltas"</code>, or <code>"nope"</code>. These choices change the generation of patterns of surface materials, and in the case of "frozen_ocean" and "eroded_badlands", add generated icebergs and buttes, respectively. For example, the mixed patterns of stone in mountains and the terracotta of mesas are coded for through these options.
**{{Nbt|compound|config}}: Configuration for the surface builder.
***{{Nbt|compound|top_material}}:{{Needs testing}} The block to use for the topmost layer of the terrain.
****{{Nbt|string|Name}}: The namespaced id of the block to use.
****{{Nbt|compound|Properties}}: Block states
*****{{Nbt|string|''state''}}: A block state key and its value.
***{{Nbt|compound|under_material}}:{{Needs testing}} The block to use directly under the topmost layer of the terrain.
****{{Nbt|string|Name}}: The namespaced id of the block to use.
****{{Nbt|compound|Properties}}: Block states
*****{{Nbt|string|''state''}}: A block state key and its value.
***{{Nbt|compound|underwater_material}}:{{Needs testing}} The block to use under bodies of water.
****{{Nbt|string|Name}}: The namespaced id of the block to use.
****{{Nbt|compound|Properties}}: Block states
*****{{Nbt|string|''state''}}: A block state key and its value.
</div>
